data.sampled: The highest ranked hand that can be formed using both the hole and community cards is Four of a Kind, with the four of diamonds. Four of a Kind consists of all four cards of the same rank, plus any other card. In this case, we have 4d in the hole and 6d, 8d, and 10d in the community cards, giving us four diamonds. Since the hole card is the highest ranking diamond, it is used to break the tie and give us Four of a Kind, Diamonds, with a rank of 4.

data.sampled:
The highest ranking hand that can be formed with these cards is: a flush, which consists of five cards of the same suit. In this case, the flush is made up of the hearts suit.

The hand would rank as follows:

5s + Qd + 5d + 10h + Kh (hearts)

Note that the ace can count as either the highest or lowest card in a straight, and can be used to complete both a straight and a flush. The order of hands is also important, so we would read this hand as "five of spades, queen of diamonds, five of diamonds, ten of hearts, king of hearts." This is a stronger hand than a straight or a full house, as a flush is always considered a higher ranking hand.
